pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the linear equivalences with dual modules given by a perfect pairing, and shows that the modules are reflexive.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: By the way, "Am I following the naming conventions properly?" should not be contained in the commit message. If you want to write something in the message that is only for reviewers and not for future users, you can write it below the `---` in the message. If so, it will be ignored when merged.

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8867218444/job/24345523272)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8867218444/job/24345523134)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8867218444/job/24345523235)
Some preliminary comments.

```suggestion
theorem toDualLeft_invFun (f : Dual R N) (x : N) : p ((p.toDualLeft).symm f) x = f x := by
```
We usually don't use `invFun` because it is merely a function and not a linear map / linear equiv. 
Maybe you can call it `apply_toDualLeft_symm_apply` etc.

You might also want to make it a simp lemma.
similarly below
You might want to double check what it generates using `simps!`. Chances are `toDualLeft_symm_apply` is not desired.
There is also `LinearEquiv.ofBijective`.
Thank you, this made the definition a lot shorter!

```suggestion
theorem toDualLeft_apply (a : M) : p.toDualLeft a = p a :=
  rfl
```
I think we should use this instead. Maybe we should even add a simp lemma
```
@[simp] lemma coe_toLin : â‡‘p.toLin = â‡‘p
```
(not tested)
Similarly below.

`coe_toLin` broke some simp proofs in `LinearAlgebrea/RootSystem/Basic`.  I could fix them by globally replacing `p.toLin` with `p.toPerfectPairing` and adding `PerfectPairing.coe_toLin` to some simp arguments.  Is this a good idea?
If you have a lemma `p.toDualRight.symm.dualMap.comp p.toDualLeft = Dual.eval R M`, the proof of  `reflexive_left` can be reduced to `rw [<- this]; exact p.bijective_toDualRight_symm_toDualLeft`.
I had tried it earlier, but had given up in the face of a `typeclass instance problem is stuck` error.  Thank you for the extra push.

```suggestion
  p.flip.reflexive_left
```
Does this work?
Yes!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (LinearAlgebra/PerfectPairing) : Modules in a perfect pairing are reflexive
